answers.answer: My sister goes to a doctor in belleville, Illinois named Dr. Tse.  She has been very pleased with her treatment.  She just had a TT on Nov 16 for papillary cancer.  Here's his info:Thomas F. Tse, MDDiabetes, Thyroid & Osteoporosis Clinic311 W Lincoln Street Suite 201Belleville, IL 62220(618) 277-5014

Dr. Tse is my endo. I find him to be very dedicated and caring to his patients. Dr Clanahan is my surgeon, also in same town. One week after TT and I feel almost ready to go back to work. My test levels were all pretty normal too. I had several nodules, but the ca was not found in the large ones. I also have had periods of mental confusion. Since TT,  I feel more my old self. I am anxious to see how my body adjust to meds. Good luck with your search

ras48,You duh!!!!  You're the one I'm talking about.  Must be the mental confusion that you forgot who your sister is!!!Everyone,Welcome my sis, ras48, to the board.  Now I guess I have to stop talking bad about her!!!MJ

Wanted to bump this threat up, so everyone could welcome, my sister, ras48, to the board who had her TT on Nov16th;Let's all give a huge Double Smile Club and  Thyca Survivors Club welcom to my favorite sister who means the world to me, cause now I have someone to help me play the "poor me, I'm trying to survive cancer " card with our siblings to get things out of like really cool Christmas presents!!!

question: I am having trouble finding a doctor in St. Louis.  One doctor I needed a resume to see him , practically. 2 others tested my levels and they were normal, but  i have been watching the nodules on my thyroid enlarge, and multiply, as I am a medical sonographer.  I am tired and have gained 20 pounds in last 2 years inspite of diet and exercise.  I have mental confusion and hair loss.  Something could very well be going on  with thyroid.  I stopped having periods last year.  I am 49 yr. old.  I want to be in the driver's seat of my health, not a victim.thank you for leading me in this matter.
title: need a doctor
